column4: lm_sensors does not report fan speed in my ubuntu 9.10 but it worked fine in my ubuntu 8.04
thats weird.  Not sure what to say other then check for bug reports on it.
lm-sensors reads info from the kernel stuff.. so im not sure how that would vanish. It could be theres some moduiles that need tobe loaded. You did run the 'sensors-detect' command ?
i ran it, it checks for a long time like never before and i added the modules it reported
you did reboot afterwards? (proberly not needed, but worth a test)
s i had done it right after installing it a week ago or so
sometimes i also get acpi resource conflict during boot
sometimes i also get acpi resource conflict message during boot
if i report a bug on it,which package i should report against can u help me?
id say start with lm-sensors - they may be able t point it to a better place.
it was made impossible to report a bug without a package name
report it on lm-sensors if the 'sensors' output is not showing the proper info i guess
when i try against with lm_sensors it says they are not using launchpad and they are asking help from me what should i do
no idea then.   check the lm_sensors web site i guess
i tried reporting bug a week ago and got angry and i stopped trying because if i tried reporting against acpi i got same message and i also tried others related to it but with no success
ive not reported a bug since beta. and even then.. all i really did was confirm other peoples bugs.
